metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4052 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use after free in web apps in Google Chrome prior to 96.0.4664.93 allowedan attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extension topotentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted Chrome Extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4052` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '97.0.4692.71-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
